verses.verse: "Is not man <WH582> forced <WH6635> to labor <WH6635> on earth, <WH776> And [are not] his days <WH3117> like the days <WH3117> of a hired <WH7916> man <WH7916>?
"As a slave <WH5650> who pants <WH7602> for the shade, <WH6738> And as a hired <WH7916> man <WH7916> who eagerly <WH6960> waits <WH6960> for his wages, <WH6467>
So <WH3651> am I allotted <WH5157> months <WH3391> of vanity, <WH7723> And nights <WH3915> of trouble <WH5999> are appointed <WH4487> me.

"When <WH518> I lie <WH7901> down <WH7901> I say, <WH559> 'When <WH4970> shall I arise <WH6965>?' But the night <WH6153> continues, <WH4058> And I am continually <WH7646> tossing <WH5076> until <WH5704> dawn. <WH5399>
"My flesh <WH1320> is clothed <WH3847> with worms <WH7415> and a crust <WH1487> of dirt; <WH6083> My skin <WH5785> hardens <WH9542> and runs. <WH9242>
"My days <WH3117> are swifter <WH7043> than <WH4480> a weaver's shuttle, <WH708> And come <WH3615> to an end <WH3615> without <WH657> hope. <WH8615>
"Remember <WH2142> that my life <WH9132> is [but] breath, <WH7307> My eye <WH5869> will not again <WH7725> see <WH7200> good. <WH9185>
"The eye <WH5869> of him who sees <WH7210> me will behold <WH7789> me no <WH3808> more; Thine eyes <WH5869> [will be] on me, but I will not be.
"When a cloud <WH6051> vanishes, <WH3615> it is gone, <WH1980> So <WH3651> he who goes <WH3381> down <WH3381> to Sheol <WH7585> does not come <WH5927> up.
"He will not return <WH7725> again <WH5750> to his house, <WH1004> Nor <WH3808> will his place <WH4725> know <WH5234> him anymore. <WH5750>

"Therefore, <WH1571> I will not restrain <WH2820> my mouth; <WH6310> I will speak <WH1696> in the anguish <WH9496> of my spirit, <WH7307> I will complain <WH7878> in the bitterness <WH4751> of my soul. <WH5315>
"Am I the sea, <WH3220> or <WH518> the sea <WH8577> monster, <WH8577> That Thou dost set <WH7760> a guard <WH4929> over <WH5921> me?
"If <WH3588> I say, <WH559> 'My bed <WH6210> will comfort <WH5162> me, My couch <WH4904> will ease <WH5375> my complaint, <WH7879>'
Then Thou dost frighten <WH2865> me with dreams <WH2472> And terrify <WH1204> me by visions; <WH2384>
So that my soul <WH5315> would choose <WH977> suffocation, <WH4267> Death <WH4194> rather <WH4480> than <WH4480> my pains. <WH6106>
"I waste <WH3988> away; <WH3988> I will not live <WH2421> forever. <WH5769> Leave <WH2308> me alone, <WH4480> for my days <WH3117> are [but] a breath. <WH1892>
"What <WH4100> is man <WH582> that Thou dost magnify <WH1431> him, And that Thou art concerned <WH7896> <WH3820> about <WH413> him,
That Thou dost examine <WH6485> him every morning, <WH1242> And try <WH974> him every moment <WH7281>?
"Wilt Thou never <WH3808> turn <WH8159> Thy gaze <WH8159> away from me, Nor <WH3808> let <WH7503> me alone <WH7503> until <WH5704> I swallow <WH1104> my spittle <WH7536>?

"Have I sinned <WH2398>? What <WH4100> have I done <WH6466> to Thee, O watcher <WH5341> of men <WH120>? Why <WH4100> hast Thou set <WH7760> me as Thy target, <WH4645> So that I am <WH1961> a burden <WH4853> to myself?

"Why <WH4100> then dost Thou not pardon <WH5375> my transgression <WH6588> And take <WH5674> away <WH5674> my iniquity <WH5771>? For now <WH6258> I will lie <WH7901> down <WH7901> in the dust; <WH6083> And Thou wilt seek <WH7836> me, but I will not be."
